bug.author: bairathirahul
bug.summary: RuntimeWarning when numpy is not imported
bug.description: I was trying the TextCategorizer example (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spacy/blob/master/examples/training/train_textcat.py>https://github.com/explosion/spacy/blob/master/examples/training/train_textcat.py</denchmark-link> ) with offline IMDB dataset. Hence I removed the import thinc.extra.datasets. That's when I started getting the following warning: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in sqrt ret = sqrt(sqnorm) After analyzing I figured out that I need to import numpy before spaCy. It's kind of confusing when someone does not need numpy in there code.

comments.comment: Thanks! I did not know that was the cause of that error. We could import numpy at the top of the spaCy or Thinc __init__.py, to make sure this doesn't occur?
I've added this fix to Thinc: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/thinc/commit/a82da48d910b64a762b50619eb75d05e91ddaadc>explosion/thinc@a82da48</denchmark-link>
